example_1: ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhun'āgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ. na t'āhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena ācikkhituṃ.
attadīpā bhikkhave, viharatha attasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā

meaning: recently; now; presently; at this time
example_1: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ adhunā-āgatavadhukāsamena cetasā viharissāmā'ti
example_2: ye te, ānanda, bhikkhū navā acirapabbajitā adhunā-āgatā imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ, te vo, ānanda, bhikkhū pañcasu dhammesu samādapetabbā nivesetabbā patiṭṭhāpetabbā

example_1: satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hit'esinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya
example_2: sādhu, bhante, bhagavā yen'āyasmā girimānando ten'upasaṅkamatu anukampaṃ upādāyā'ti.

example_1: sādhu no bhante bhagavā suciraparinibbuto'pi pacchimājanata-anukampamānasā
example_2: satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hit'esinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
example_3: so tasmiṃ purise kāruññaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, anuddayaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, anukampaṃ'y'eva upaṭṭhāpeyya, aho vat'āyaṃ puriso labheyya sappāyāni bhojanāni, labheyya sappāyāni bhesajjāni, labheyya patirūpaṃ upaṭṭhākaṃ, labheyya gām'antanāyakaṃ!

meaning: not fulfilled one's wish (of); not reached the goal (of); not mentally attained; (comm) not attained arahantship
example_1: sekhassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno appattamānasassa anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ patthayamānassa viharato ajjhattikaṃ aṅgan'ti karitvā n'āññaṃ ek'aṅgam'pi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ bah'ūpakāraṃ yatha'y'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yoniso manasikāro.
example_2: yo'pi so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sekkho appattamānaso anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ patthayamāno viharati, so'pi pathaviṃ pathavito abhijānāti, pathaviṃ pathavito abhiññāya pathaviṃ mā maññi

meaning: not removed; not given up; not abandoned
example_1: bhikkhu yathā iṇaṃ yathā rogaṃ yathā bandhan'āgāraṃ yathā dāsabyaṃ yathā kantār'addhānamaggaṃ, ime pañca nīvaraṇe appahīne attani samanupassati
example_2: yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno abhijjhālussa abhijjhā appahīnā hoti, byāpannacittassa byāpādo appahīno hoti, kodhanassa kodho appahīno hoti
example_3: bhavasaṃyojane ca kho appahīne bhavo'pi appahīno hotī'ti, iti vadaṃ dhammam'eva deseti.

example_1: na me, āvuso sāriputta, khamanīyaṃ na yāpanīyaṃ, bāḷhā me dukkhā vedanā abhikkamanti no paṭikkamanti, abhikkamo'sānaṃ paññāyati no paṭikkamo.
atha puriso āgaccheyya jīvitu'kāmo amaritu'kāmo sukhakāmo dukkhappaṭikūlo
eka-ayano ayaṃ, bhikkhave, maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya yadidaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā.

meaning: not annoyed; not irritated; not upset; untroubled
example_1: yaṃ kho pan'assa bhojanaṃ denti, lūkhaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā, taṃ sakkaccaṃ'y'eva paribhuñjati avihaññamāno.
example_2: bhusā sudaṃ bhagavato vedanā vattanti sārīrikā vedanā dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā asātā amanāpā, tā sudaṃ bhagavā sato sampajāno adhivāseti avihaññamāno.

example_1: idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu gilāno hoti. so ce bhikkhūnaṃ santike dūtaṃ pahiṇeyya, ahañ'hi gilāno, āgacchantu bhikkhū, icchāmi bhikkhūnaṃ āgatan'ti.
example_2: ahañ'hi, bho gotama, evaṃvādī evaṃdiṭṭhī, yo koci diṭṭhaṃ bhāsati, evaṃ me diṭṭhan'ti, n'atthi tato doso
example_3: n'atthi nu kho taṃ kiñci lokasmiṃ yam'ahaṃ upādiyamāno na vajjavā assaṃ. ahañ'hi rūpaññ'eva upādiyamāno upādiyeyyaṃ
example_4: ahañhi arahā loke, ahaṃ satthā anuttaro. ekomhi sammāsambuddho, sītibhūtosmi nibbuto.

example_1: yāvakīvañ'ca bhikkhave bhikkhū paccattaññ'eva satiṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti, kin'ti anāgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī āgaccheyyuṃ āgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī phāsuṃ vihareyyun'ti
example_2: eta'r'ahi vā paccuppannam'addhānaṃ ajjhattaṃ kathaṃkathī hoti, ahaṃ nu kho'smi? no nu kho'smi? kiṃ nu kho'smi? kathaṃ nu kho'smi? ayaṃ nu kho satto kuto āgato? so kuhiṃ gāmī bhavissatī'ti?
example_3: cirappavāsiṃ purisaṃ, dūrato sotthim'āgataṃ, ñātimittā suhajjā ca, abhinandanti āgataṃ.

example_1: iminā puññakammena upajjhāyā guṇ'uttarā, ācariy'ūpakārā ca mātāpitā ca ñātakā, suriyo candimā rājā, guṇavantā narā'pi ca
example_2: ime kho, bhikkhave, dve sukkā dhammā lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, na'y'idha paññāyetha mātā'ti vā mātucchā'ti vā mātulānī'ti vā ācariyabhariyā'ti vā garūnaṃ dārā'ti vā.
example_3: kiñ'ci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāyā'ti leso nāma dasa lesā, jātileso, nāmaleso, gottaleso, liṅgaleso, āpattileso, pattaleso, cīvaraleso, upajjhāyaleso, ācariyaleso, sen'āsanaleso.
example_4: so aparena samayena saṃvāsam'anvāya vissāsam'anvāya ācariyam'pi upajjhāyam'pi evam'āha, apetha, kiṃ pana tumhe jānāthā'ti!

example_1: yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, kāyagatāsati abhāvitā abahulīkatā, labhati tassa māro otāraṃ, labhati tassa māro ārammaṇaṃ.
example_2: kaliṅgar'ūpadhānā, bhikkhave, eta'r'ahi licchavī viharanti appamattā ātāpino upāsanasmiṃ. tesaṃ rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto na labhati otāraṃ na labhati ārammaṇaṃ.

meaning: taking; taking up; grasping (onto); taking possession (of)
example_1: puṇṇo nāma, āvuso, āyasmā mantāṇiputto amhākaṃ navakānaṃ sataṃ bah'ūpakāro hoti. so amhe iminā ovādena ovadati, upādāya, āvuso ānanda, asmī'ti hoti, no anupādāya.
example_2: yaṃ kho, bhikkhu, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hit'esinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.

example_1: etha passath'imaṃ lokaṃ, cittaṃ rājarath'ūpamaṃ, yattha bālā visīdanti, n'atthi saṅgo vijānataṃ.
example_2: yo nibbanatho van'ādhimutto, vanamutto vanam'eva dhāvati, taṃ puggalam'etha passatha, mutto bandhanam'eva dhāvati.
example_3: etha tumhe mā anussavena, mā param'parāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu

meaning: I hope; I trust; I wonder
example_1: kacci nu kho me attā sīlato na upavadatī'ti, pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ.
example_2: kacci, bhante, bhagavā sukham'asayitthā'ti? evaṃ, kumāra, sukham'asayitthaṃ. ye ca pana loke sukhaṃ senti, ahaṃ tesaṃ aññataro'ti
example_3: kacci, tāta uttara, taṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ tathā santaṃ'y'eva saddo abbhuggato, no aññathā? kacci pana so bhavaṃ gotamo tādiso, no aññādiso'ti?
example_4: uddiṭṭhaṃ kho, āyasmanto, nidānaṃ. tatth'āyasmante pucchāmi, kacci'ttha parisuddhā?

example_1: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.

meaning: name of a park outside Rājagaha
example_1: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
kammassakomhi kammadāy'ādo kammayoni kammabandhu kammapaṭisaraṇo, yaṃ kammaṃ karissāmi kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā tassa dāy'ādo bhavissāmī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ
example_2: so dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāseti.
example_3: mā maṃ āyasmanto kiñci avacuttha kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā, ahaṃ'p'āyasmante na kiñci vakkhāmi kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā
example_4: kiñ'cā'pi, bhikkhave, evarūpassa puggalassa na diṭṭh'ānugatiṃ āpajjati, atha kho naṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati, kalyāṇamitto purisapuggalo kalyāṇasahāyo kalyāṇasampavaṅko'ti.

example_1: ekadā dhammarājā pi gelaññen'ābhipīḷito cundattherena taññ'eva bhaṇāpetvāna sādaraṃ sammoditvā ca ābādhā tamhā vuṭṭhāsi ṭhānaso.
example_2: ahaṃ kho gilānā vuṭṭhito aciravuṭṭhito gelaññā. tassa me kāyo dubbalo akammañño. hand'āhaṃ nipajjāmī'ti. so nipajjati, na vīriyaṃ ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.

meaning: wishing to live; wanting to stay alive
example_1: atha puriso āgaccheyya jīvitu'kāmo amaritu'kāmo sukhakāmo dukkhappaṭikūlo
example_2: vāṇijo'va bhayaṃ maggaṃ, appasattho mahaddhano, visaṃ jīvitu'kāmo'va, pāpāni parivajjaye.

meaning: to live; to remain alive; to survive
example_1: pārājiko hotī'ti seyyathā'pi nāma puriso sīsacchinno abhabbo tena sarīrabandhanena jīvituṃ, evam'eva bhikkhu methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevitvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo. tena vuccati, pārājiko hotī'ti.
example_2: atha naṃ piṇḍāya caritvā jīvituṃ samatthakāle sā kapālakaṃ hatthe ṭhapetvā.
example_3: atha puriso āgaccheyya jīvitu'kāmo amaritu'kāmo sukhakāmo dukkhappaṭikūlo.

meaning: terra firma; solid ground; support; help; refuge; place of safety; epithet of Nibbāna
example_1: attadīpā, bhikkhave, viharatha attasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā, dhammadīpā dhammasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā.
example_2: majjhe sarasmiṃ tiṭṭhataṃ, oghe jāte mahabbhaye, jarāmaccuparetānaṃ, dīpaṃ pabrūmi kappa te.
example_3: uṭṭhānen'appamādena, saṃyamena damena ca, dīpaṃ kayirātha medhāvī, yaṃ ogho n'ābhikīrati.

meaning: discomfort and distress; pain and stress; physical pain and mental suffering
example_1: vedanāpaccayā taṇhā, taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ, upādānapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṃ sokaparidevadukkhadomanass'upāyāsā sambhavanti.
example_2: ek'āyano ayaṃ, bhikkhave, maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya yadidaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā

example_1: patirūpadesavāso ca, pubbe ca katapuññatā, attasammāpaṇidhi ca, etam'maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
example_2: upajjhāyamhi vuṭṭhite āsanaṃ uddharitabbaṃ. sace so deso uklāpo hoti, so deso sammajjitabbo.
example_3: patirūpe vase dese, ariyamittakaro siyā. sammāpaṇidhisampanno, pubbe puññakato naro. dhaññaṃ dhanaṃ yaso kitti, sukhaṃcetaṃadhivattatī.
example_4: daddabhāyati bhaddante, yasmiṃ dese vasām'ahaṃ, aham'p'etaṃ na jānāmi, kim'etaṃ duddubhāyati.

meaning: with Dhamma as one's place of safety; with Dhamma as one's solid ground
example_1: dhammadīpā dhammasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā

meaning: taking refuge in the Dhamma; relying on the Dhamma; finding support in the teaching
example_1: attadīpā, bhikkhave, viharatha attasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā, dhammadīpā dhammasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā.
nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane. nisajja pāde pakkhālesi.
example_2: nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi

meaning: having dressed up (in); having robed up; having put on; having donned
example_1: atha kho bhagavā kismiñci'd'eva pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇāmetvā pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaram'ādāya kapilavatthuṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi

meaning: should be established (in); should be settled (in)
example_1: ye te, ānanda, bhikkhū navā acirapabbajitā adhun'āgatā imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ, te vo, ānanda, bhikkhū pañcasu dhammesu samādapetabbā nivesetabbā patiṭṭhāpetabbā
so santuṭṭho hoti kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena. so yena yen'eva pakkamati, samādāy'eva pakkamati
example_2: so taṃ pokkharaṇiṃ ogāhetvā ubhohi hatthehi itic'iti ca sevālapaṇakaṃ apaviyūhitvā añjalinā pivitvā pakkameyya.
example_3: yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre jānaṃ pubb'upagataṃ bhikkhuṃ anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappeyya yassa sambādho bhavissati, so pakkamissatī'ti etadeva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.
example_4: yadā pana mayaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ suṇāma, kosalehi mallesu cārikaṃ pakkamissatī'ti, hoti no tasmiṃ samaye anattamanatā hoti domanassaṃ, dūre no bhagavā bhavissatī'ti.

example_1: atha puriso āgaccheyya jīvitu'kāmo amaritu'kāmo sukhakāmo dukkhappaṭikūlo
patirūpadesavāso ca, pubbe ca katapuññatā. attasammāpaṇidhi ca, etam'maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
example_2: attānam'eva paṭhamaṃ, patirūpe nivesaye, ath'aññam'anusāseyya, na kilisseyya paṇḍito.
example_3: ahañ'c'eva kho pana jarādhammo samāno jaraṃ anatīto paraṃ jiṇṇaṃ disvā aṭṭīyeyyaṃ harāyeyyaṃ jiguccheyyaṃ na m'etaṃ assa patirūpan'ti.
example_4: atha kho brahmāyuno brāhmaṇassa avidūre ambavanassa etadahosi, na kho m'etaṃ patirūpaṃ yo'haṃ pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito samaṇaṃ gotamaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkameyyan'ti.

example_1: yāni kho pan'assa honti sāṭheyyāni kūṭeyyāni jimheyyāni vaṅkeyyāni, tāni yathābhūtaṃ āvikattā hoti satthari vā viññūsu vā sabrahmacārīsu.
example_2: sace pan'assa pubbe vuttanayen'eva verimhi paṭighaṃ uppajjati, taṃ mettāya vuttanayen'eva vūpasametabbaṃ.
example_3: parosahassaṃ kho pan'assa puttā bhavanti sūrā vīr'aṅgarūpā parasenappamaddanā.

meaning: but I; then I; and I
example_1: n'āhaṃ, moggallāna, sabbeh'eva saṃsaggaṃ vaṇṇayāmi na pan'āhaṃ, moggallāna, sabbeh'eva saṃsaggaṃ na vaṇṇayāmi
example_2: aññāya ca pan'āhaṃ samaṇānaṃ sakyaputtikānaṃ dhammaṃ ev'āhaṃ tasmā dhammavinayā apakkanto'ti?
example_3: abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ, sāriputta, caturaṅgasamannāgataṃ brahmacariyaṃ caritā, tapassī su'daṃ homi paramatapassī
example_4: varaṃ, bhikkhave, sottaṃ. sottaṃ kho pan'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, vañjhaṃ jīvitānaṃ vadāmi, aphalaṃ jīvitānaṃ vadāmi, momūhaṃ jīvitānaṃ vadāmi

example_1: ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, sunakkhatta, vijjati yaṃ idh'ekacco purisapuggalo lok'āmis'ādhimutto assa.
example_2: ataramāno'va bhāseyya no taramāno'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ?
example_3: maraṇadhammānaṃ sattānaṃ evaṃ icchā uppajjati aho vata mayaṃ na maraṇadhammā assāma, na ca vata no maraṇaṃ āgaccheyyā'ti. na kho pan'etaṃ icchāya pattabbaṃ, idam'pi yam'p'icchaṃ na labhati tam'pi dukkhaṃ

example_1: sabbaṃ dhammaṃ pariññāya yaṃkiñci vedanaṃ vediyati sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkham'asukhaṃ vā so tāsu vedanāsu anicc'ānupassī viharati
example_2: nāhaṃ sabbe samaṇabrāhmaṇāse, jātijarāya nivutā'ti brūmi, ye s'īdha diṭṭhaṃ'va sutaṃ mutaṃ vā, sīlabbataṃ vā'pi pahāya sabbaṃ, anekarūpam'pi pahāya sabbaṃ, taṇhaṃ pariññāya anāsavāse, te ve narā oghatiṇṇā'ti brūmi.
example_3: sa ve samm'addaso bhikkhu, parijānāti vedanā. so vedanā pariññāya, diṭṭhe dhamme anāsavo. kāyassa bhedā dhammaṭṭho, saṅkhyaṃ n'opeti vedagū'ti.
example_4: ubhosu antesu vineyya chandaṃ, phassaṃ pariññāya anānugiddho, yadattagarahī tadakubbamāno, na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.

example_1: ahaṃ sukhito homi niddukkho homi avero homi abyāpajjho homi anīgho homi sukhī attānaṃ pariharāmi
example_2: dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato paṇḍito viyatto sappuriso akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati anavajjo ca hoti ananuvajjo ca viññūnaṃ bahuñ'ca puññaṃ pasavati.
example_3: so attānaṃ'y'eva adhipatiṃ karitvā akusalaṃ pajahati, kusalaṃ bhāveti, sāvajjaṃ pajahati, anavajjaṃ bhāveti, suddhaṃ attānaṃ pariharati. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, att'ādhipateyyaṃ.
example_4: seyyathā'pi puriso medakathālikaṃ parihareyya chidd'āvachiddaṃ uggharantaṃ paggharantaṃ, evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ pariharāmi

example_1: atha kho bhagavā kismiñci'd'eva pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṇāmetvā pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaram'ādāya kapilavatthuṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi
example_2: tam'enaṃ pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ sattisatena haneyyuṃ. atha rājā majjh'anhikasamayaṃ evaṃ vadeyya, ambho, kathaṃ so puriso'ti?

meaning: extremely ill; very sick; with strong illness
example_1: ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan'ti?
example_2: seyyathā'pi bhikkhave puriso ābādhiko assa dukkhito bāḷhagilāno

meaning: methinks; one might say; you'd think; as it were
example_1: tassa evaṃ hoti, mayaṃ kho pubbe agāriyabhūtā samānā aññe ovadāma'pi anusāsāma'pi. ime pan'amhākaṃ puttamattā maññe nattamattā maññe ovaditabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññantī'ti.
example_2: atha kho māro pāpimā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato avidūre mahantaṃ bhayabheravaṃ saddam'akāsi, apissudaṃ pathavī maññe undrīyati
example_3: te kilesā pavaḍḍhantā, āvisanti bahuṃ janaṃ. kīḷanti maññe bālehi, ummattehi'va rakkhasā.
example_4: asītivassasahass'āyukesu, bhikkhave, manussesu ayaṃ jambudīpo avīci maññe phuṭo bhavissati manussehi, seyyathā'pi naḷavanaṃ vā saravanaṃ vā.

example_1: kaṇhaṃ dhammaṃ vippahāya, sukkaṃ bhāvetha paṇḍito, okā anokam'āgamma, viveke yattha dūramaṃ.
example_2: hitvā icchañ'ca lobhañ'ca, yattha satto puthujjano, cakkhumā paṭipajjeyya, tareyya narakaṃ imaṃ.
example_3: yaṃnūna mayaṃ imaṃ nivāpaṃ nivuttaṃ mahatīhi daṇḍavākarāhi samantā sappadesaṃ anuparivāreyyāma, app'eva nāma tatiyānaṃ migajātānaṃ āsayaṃ passeyyāma, yattha te gāhaṃ gaccheyyun'ti.
example_4: gāme vā yadi v'āraññe, ninne vā yadi vā thale. yattha arahanto viharanti, taṃ bhūmirāmaṇeyyakan'ti.

meaning: in whoever; in whichever; at whichever
example_1: yasmiṃ c'assā padese ṭhitāya evam'assa, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ agatapubbañ'c'eva disaṃ gaccheyyaṃ, akhāditapubbāni ca tiṇāni khādeyyaṃ, apītapubbāni ca pānīyāni piveyyan'ti tañ'ca padesaṃ na sotthinā paccāgaccheyya.
example_2: yasmiṃ kāmā na vasanti, taṇhā yassa na vijjati, kathaṃkathā ca yo tiṇṇo, vimokkho tassa n'āparo.
example_3: yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye rājāno balavanto honti, corā tasmiṃ samaye dubbalā honti.

meaning: what if I were to; let me; I shall; perhaps I
example_1: tassā evam'assa, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ agatapubbañ'c'eva disaṃ gaccheyyaṃ, akhāditapubbāni ca tiṇāni khādeyyaṃ, apītapubbāni ca pānīyāni piveyyan'ti.
example_2: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ saṃkaḍḍhitvā, kullaṃ bandhitvā, taṃ kullaṃ nissāya hatthehi ca pādehi ca vāyamamāno sotthinā pāraṃ uttareyyan'ti.
example_3: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ bhagavantaṃ sammukhā sāruppāya gāthāya abhitthaveyyan'ti.
example_4: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ imaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjitvā jighacchādubbalyaṃ paṭivinodetvā evaṃ imaṃ rattin'divaṃ vītināmeyyan'ti

example_1: bhikkhu ye te lābhā dhammikā dhammaladdhā antamaso pattapariyāpannamattam'pi, tathārūpehi lābhehi appaṭivibhattabhogī hoti sīlavantehi sabrahmacārīhi sādhāraṇabhogī.
example_2: āsīsanti thomayanti abhijappanti juhanti, kām'ābhijappanti paṭicca lābhaṃ, te yājayogā bhavarāgarattā, n'ātariṃsu jātijaran'ti brūmi.
example_3: ārogyaparamā lābhā, santuṭṭhiparamaṃ dhanaṃ, vissāsaparamā ñāti, nibbānaṃ paramaṃ sukhaṃ.
example_4: kiṃ nu kho mayaṃ āyasmato anuruddhassa evam'ārocimha, imāsañ'ca imāsañ'ca vihārasamāpattīnaṃ mayaṃ lābhino'ti

example_1: yāvakīvañ'ca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti.
example_2: iti jānāmi iti passāmī'ti jānām'ahaṃ ete dhamme, passām'ahaṃ ete dhamme, atthi ca ete dhammā mayi, ahañ'ca etesu dhammesu sandissāmī'ti.

example_1: sabbamaññitānaṃ tv'eva, bhikkhu, samatikkamā muni santo'ti vuccati. muni kho pana, bhikkhu, santo na jāyati, na jīyati, na mīyati, na kuppati, na piheti.
example_2: ek'āyano ayaṃ, bhikkhave, maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya yadidaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā
example_3: sabbaso rūpasaññānaṃ samatikkamā paṭīghasaññānaṃ atthaṅ'gamā nānattasaññānaṃ amanasikārā, ananto ākāso'ti ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ upasampajja viharati

example_1: atha puriso āgaccheyya jīvitu'kāmo amaritu'kāmo sukhakāmo dukkhappaṭikūlo
example_2: sukhakāmāni bhūtāni, yo daṇḍena vihiṃsati, attano sukham'esāno, pecca so na labhate sukhaṃ.

meaning: trainee; apprentice; learner; initiate; (comm) seven stages of a noble person before arahantship
example_1: ime bhikkhave dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
example_2: samaññāya bhikkhu, paṭiññāya bhikkhu, ehi bhikkhū'ti bhikkhu, tīhi saraṇagamanehi upasampanno'ti bhikkhu, bhadro bhikkhu, sāro bhikkhu, sekho bhikkhu, asekho bhikkhu
example_3: sekho pathaviṃ vicessati, yamalokañ'ca imaṃ sadevakaṃ, sekho dhammapadaṃ sudesitaṃ, kusalo puppham'iva pacessati.

meaning: sorrow and mourning; sadness and crying
example_1: acchariyaṃ, āvuso, abbhutaṃ, āvuso! yāvañ'c'idaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena sambādhe okās'ādhigamo anubuddho sattānaṃ visuddhiyā sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya ñāyassa adhigamāya nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya.
dhammo padīpo viya tassa satthuno, yo maggapāk'āmatabhedabhinnako, lok'uttaro yo ca tadattha'dīpano
example_2: manujassa pamattacārino, taṇhā vaḍḍhati māluvā viya, so plavatī hurā huraṃ, phalam'icchaṃ'va vanasmi vānaro.
example_3: saṅkappehi pareto so, kapaṇo viya jhāyati, sutvā paresaṃ nigghosaṃ, maṅku hoti tathāvidho.
example_4: tam'enaṃ jano disvā evaṃ vadeyya, ambho, kim'ev'idaṃ harīyati jaññajaññaṃ viyā'ti?

example_1: sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā'ti, yadā paññāya passati, atha nibbindati dukkhe, esa maggo visuddhiyā.
example_2: es'eva maggo n'atth'añño, dassanassa visuddhiyā, etañ'hi tumhe paṭipajjatha, mārass'etaṃ pamohanaṃ.
example_3: ek'āyano ayaṃ maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā, sokaparidevānaṃ samatikkamāya, dukkhadomanassānaṃ atthaṅ'gamāya, ñāyassa adhigamāya, nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yadidaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā.

example_1: sabbe saddhammagaruno, vihariṃsu viharanti ca. atho'pi viharissanti, esā buddhāna dhammatā.
example_2: tadanuttaraṃ brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
example_3: so evaṃ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇ'ātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇ'ātipātā paṭivirato ahosiṃ nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī day'āpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahit'ānukampī vihāsiṃ.
example_4: rājamahāmatto vā pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricārayamāno kāmataṇhaṃ appahāya kāmapariḷāhaṃ appaṭivinodetvā vigatapipāso ajjhattaṃ vūpasantacitto vihāsi vā viharati vā viharissati vā.

meaning: name of a city; capital of the Licchavis
example_1: vesāliyaṃ vane viharantaṃ, aggaṃ sattassa sambuddhaṃ, kokanad'āham'asmi abhivande, kokanadā pajjunnassa dhītā.
example_2: sace'pi me ayyaputtā vesāliṃ s'āhāraṃ dajjeyyātha n'eva dajjāhaṃ taṃ bhattan'ti
example_3: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ. atha kho mahāpajāpatī gotamī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami

example_1: phalaṃ ve kadaliṃ hanti, phalaṃ veḷuṃ phalaṃ naḷaṃ, sakkāro kāpurisaṃ hanti, gabbho assatariṃ yathā'ti.
example_2: saññācikā nāma sayaṃ yācitvā purisam'pi puris'atthakaram'pi goṇam'pi sakaṭam'pi vāsim'pi parasum'pi kuṭhārim'pi kudālam'pi nikhādanam'pi vallim'pi veḷum'pi muñjam'pi pabbajam'pi tiṇam'pi mattikam'pi.
example_3: et'āhaṃ, bhante, veḷuvanaṃ uyyānaṃ buddhappamukhassa bhikkhusaṅghassa dammī'ti.

meaning: name of a park outside Rājagaha
example_1: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
example_2: atha kho te attano antevāsikehi aḍḍhateyyehi paribbājakasatehi saddhiṃ veḷuvanaṃ agamaṃsu.
example_3: atha kho rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro sovaṇṇamayaṃ bhiṅkāraṃ gahetvā bhagavato oṇojesi, et'āhaṃ, bhante, veḷuvanaṃ uyyānaṃ buddhappamukhassa bhikkhusaṅghassa dammī'ti.

example_1: hatthesu, bhikkhave, sati ādānanikkhepanaṃ paññāyati. pādesu sati abhikkamapaṭikkamo paññāyati. pabbesu sati samiñjanapasāraṇaṃ paññāyati. kucchismiṃ sati jighacchāpipāsā paññāyati.
example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sunakkhatta, api nu so puriso amussa āsīvisassa ghoravisassa hatthaṃ vā aṅguṭṭhaṃ vā dajjā yaṃ jaññā, imin'āhaṃ daṭṭho maraṇaṃ vā nigacchāmi maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhan'ti?
example_3: na sāmisena hatthena pānīyathālakaṃ paṭiggahessāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.
example_4: yo pana bhikkhu, otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena, mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjeyya, hatthaggāhaṃ vā veṇiggāhaṃ vā aññatarassa vā aññatarassa vā aṅgassa parāmasanaṃ, saṅghādiseso.
